text:
Role:

Automate deployment and lifecycle of complex microservice-based application deployed in cloud ecosystem (Openshift, Openstack). Strict availability requirements are applied on application and its lifecycle operations (patch installation, switch to redundant instance).
Participate in IaaS/PaaS ecosystem (Openshift/Openstack) availability and performance improvements
Understand existing processes bottleneck and perform optimization
Manage team of DevOps engineers who will deliver application to production, perform operation, monitoring and maintenance
Lead troubleshooting and incidents resolution
Additional opportunity ‚Äì take part in continuous integration/delivery pipeline automation projects
Required:

 Deep understanding of highly available systems design- active-passive; active-active; 1+1 and N+1 redundancy, highly available physical architecture
Experience of Linux administration (CentOS, Ubuntu) ‚Äì bash, IPTables, DNS, yum/apt-get
Experience in Linux High Availability stack (corosync, pacemaker)
Experience in automation tools (in decreasing priority order) : Ansible, Chef, Puppet
Experience in container virtualization ‚Äì Docker, Docker ecosystem (private dockerhub, image delivery to production)
Good knowledge in Openstack: installation, automation, availability
Good knowledge in Openshift: installation, automation, availability
JBoss (WildFly) administration and installation automation
Management of 3-5 engineers team
Beneficial:

 Experience in Java
Experience in Python/Ruby/Groovy
Experience in distributed file systems- Ceph, GlusterFS
Source control principles and experience in Git, SVN.
Build automation tools ‚Äì Maven, Gradle
PostgreSQL installation and administration
MongoDB installation and administration
Experience in VMWare
Experience in Jenkins
